newsitem.title: USA: McAfee jumps 8 pct on Merrill buy rating.
newsitem.headline: McAfee jumps 8 pct on Merrill buy rating.

text.p: Shares of McAfee Associates Inc rose more than eight percent on volume of over two million after Merrill Lynch initiated coverage of the security management software products company.
Shares of McAfee, based in Santa Clara, Calif., rose $5.13 to $66.75.
Merrill analyst Bruce Smith said in a research note he expects McAfee, which markets software to guard against computer viruses, to shift into organization-wide markets.

Smith said McAfee should trade at a multiple equal to its long-term growth rate of 35 percent, noting that at this ratio the stock should have a price objective of $84 based on his 1998 earnings per share estimate of $2.40.
"McAfee has experienced explosive growth as demand for anti-virus protection has increased at the same time that McAfee has gained significant market share," he wrote.

The company is developing a new suite strategy in the anti-virus software market that "should add significantly to growth," and its help desk and service desk areas should offer major growth opportunities, he said.
